definition: paper tiger
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
variant of 紙|纸[zhi3]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: All reactionaries are paper tigers. In appearance, the reactionaries are terrifying, but in reality they are not sopowerful.
sentences.chinese: 一切所有号称强大的反动派统统不过是纸老虎。

sentences.english: It is time to leave the theater and see China for what it is.
sentences.chinese: 是时候揭开纸老虎的画皮，直视中国的真实面目。

sentences.english: But you see many more paper tigers than real ones.
sentences.chinese: 但是还是纸老虎多一些。
他实际上只是一个纸老虎。

sentences.english: All difficulties are also paper tigers.
sentences.chinese: 一切困难也都是纸老虎。

sentences.english: All reactionaries are paper tigers. In appearance, the reactionaries are terrifying, but in reality they are not so powerful.
sentences.chinese: 一切所有号称强大的反动派统统不过是纸老虎。

sentences.english: All the plagiarists are paper tigers.
sentences.chinese: 一切抄袭派都是纸老虎。

sentences.english: China, as I say again, is a paper tiger, more like a pussycat.
sentences.chinese: 中国就是纸老虎，更像个娘们。

definition: strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
(false) bravado/to bluff
a mantis trying to stop a chariot (idiom)/to overrate oneself and attempt sth impossible/also written 螳臂擋車|螳臂挡车[tang2 bi4 dang3 che1]
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to scare/to frighten
evil monsters/(fig.) bad characters/(political) bad elements
to be frightened
an American (derog.)/a Yankee
lit. show strength while weak inside (idiom); appearing fierce while cowardly at heart/a sheep in wolf's clothing
to scare people/to bluff/to deceive
coward
looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
pinyin: bing1 lai2 jiang4 dang3 , shui3 lai2 tu3 yan3

definition: lit. an ant trying to shake a big tree (idiom)/fig. to overrate one's own strength/also written 蚍蜉撼樹|蚍蜉撼树[pi2 fu2 han4 shu4]
